result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesse A Gibson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

-serve 60 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/Work-Release privileges; to commence consecutive to any other sentence in being,

--To submit a DNA Sample

--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his/her system.  Non-compliance will result in loss of Huber/work-release privileges without further process.



Consecutive to: Any Other Sentence In Being

Letter from Defendant requesting reinstatement of Huber
from defendant requesting that his payments be stopped until he is released in October
Issue already addressed on the record. no further action

Case called at 3:21 pm [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for STC)
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Jesse A Gibson in court, in-custody, with Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered on Count #2; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #1
Court reviews for the record, letter from victim received today

On Count #2, the Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 60 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/Work-Release privileges; to commence consecutive to any other sentence in being
--0 days credit for time already served given
--pay costs of $443  + $100 domestic abuse surcharge = $543; due in $25 increments per month beginning 5/1/16 and on the 1st day of the month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment results in a 5 day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive.
--To submit a DNA Sample
Recess: 3:45 pm
from Ms. Heinecke requesting the no contact be lifted
State Public Defender Determination of Financial Eligibility - Defendant not eligible.

case called at 1:22-pm. [mo[
Defendant Jesse A Gibson appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek(for Bond Purposes only).  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

Atty. Svehlek indicates that a financial evaluation was not completed as Mr. Gibson indicates that he intends to retain private counsel

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Defendant verifies name, dob, and address on criminal complaint
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant


The Court requires a $1,500  signature bond, with conditions:
--no acts or threats of violence
--no contact with Tricia Heinecke, except in a public location for purposes exchange of minor child, to be consistent with any family court order
--no presence at 677 E. Lake St. Lot #26, Lake Mills
--booking at JESO
recess 1:27  pm. 


NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 2/3/16 at 9:20am   (2) Status Conference on 2/22/16 at 3:00pm
